events.name: Guide to Android Apps Programming
events.description:
This workshop introduces participants to the basic fundamentals of developing Android apps. The workshop will cover Android framework, creating Layouts, Activities, Views, Intents and explore functions available (maps, notifications, web services). Participants are required to bring their own laptops(do install Android Studio) and an Android phone to make the workshop a meaningful experience. 
  
 
  
This workshop, together with 4 other workshops including Guide to iOS Apps Programming 1,  Guide to iOS Apps Programming 2, Working With Data and Learn to write a WordPress/Rezkii plugin with web services are pre-workshops that lead up to the actual *hackathon day.  
  
  
*Participants' for this workshop are not required to attend the hackathon, but if you want to, here's where you sign up: Mosque Tech Challenge
events.location: The Hive, Blk K, , ITE College Central (Ang Mo Kio), 2 Ang Mo Kio Drive, Singapore 567720

events.name: Making With Light
events.description: Its the International Year of Light! Light plays a vital role in our daily lives and is an imperative cross-cutting discipline of science in the 21st century. It has revolutionized medicine and opened up international communication. Come join us and tinker with Light

events.name: Conversations: Doug Cooper, DreamWorks Animation
events.description: Conversations Doug Cooper, DreamWorks Animation Saturday 13 June, 2pm â€“ 3pm Level 4, ArtScience Museum FREE Doors open at 1.30pm. Attendance is on a first come, first served basis. Don't miss this unique opportunity to hear Doug Cooper, Special Effects Supervisor at DreamWorks Animation, describe the Dragon Flight sequence in the exhibition, and will provide a fascinating overview of the creation of key special effects in other DreamWorks Animation films. A must-see for all those interested in special effects and animation.
